Headline: Evening Update: Today's headlines from The Straits Times on June 15, Singapore News & Top Stories - The Straits Times
Text: Read 3 articles daily and stand to win ST rewards, including the ST News Tablet worth $398.Spin the wheel for ST Read and Win now.Good evening! Catch up on some of the main headlines on Tuesday, June 15. He was tasked with providing reports on issues of interest to his foreign handlers, including information on S'pore, said ISD.READ MORE HEREThey include AIA Financial Advisers, Prudential Assurance Company Singapore, Aviva and Aviva Financial Advisers.READ MORE HEREThe tests would be carried out on June 15 and 16 at Block 84A Redhill Lane. READ MORE HEREFor the first time since June 29, 2020, there were no imported cases reported.READ MORE HEREThe treatment did not achieve the main goal of preventing symptomatic Covid-19.READ MORE HEREThe fire, on the 3rd storey ceiling and attic of the shophouse, was extinguished at about 1.15pm.READ MORE HEREThe charges include those involving the Immigration and Checkpoints Authority.READ MORE HEREThe midfielder said he is feeling okay after collapsing during his country's Euro 2020 opener.READ MORE HEREMalaysia might gradually open up its economy, social sectors and also Parliament from September.READ MORE HERE​But the drop in sales volume was not as drastic as during the first month of the circuit breaker in April 2020.READ MORE HEREJoin ST's Telegram channel here and get the latest breaking news delivered to you.SPH Digital News / Copyright © 2021 Singapore Press Holdings Ltd.
